metadata.title: CVE-2022-2663 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was found in the Linux kernel in nf_conntrack_irc where themessage handling can be confused and incorrectly matches the message. Afirewall may be able to be bypassed when users are using unencrypted IRCwith nf_conntrack_irc configured.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-2663` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-generic - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-239-lowlatency - 4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1117-aws - 4.4.0-1117.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1162-azure - 4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-239.273~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1117.123').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1162.177~14.04.1').
